title: 107_hr1776
content: The Act may be cited as the "Buffalo Bayou National Heritage Area Study Act". The National Park Service will conduct a study regarding Buffalo Bayou in Texas. The Congress finds that Buffalo Bayou in Texas has made unique contributions to cultural, political, and industrial development in the United States. It played a significant role in Texas independence, developed a prosperous shipping industry, and led in the development of the petrochemical industry in Houston. The Buffalo Bayou in America played a key role in the development of Houston, with a sophisticated shipping system and industrial base. The Buffalo Bayou Partnership is committed to completing the Buffalo Bayou Trail. Preservation and promotion of the bayou's significance for transportation, industry, commerce, and immigration are needed. The Department of the Interior should protect the cultural and historical resources in the region. The Federal Government, in cooperation with the Buffalo Bayou Partnership, Inc., the State of Texas, and other entities, will develop programs to conserve and interpret the heritage of the Buffalo Bayou in Houston. The Secretary will conduct a study to determine the feasibility of establishing the Buffalo Bayou National Heritage Area, analyzing its natural, historic, and cultural resources. The curr_chunk emphasizes the importance of recognizing and conserving American heritage through partnerships and diverse resources, reflecting traditions and providing recreational and educational opportunities. It also highlights the significance of conserving natural, historic, cultural, and scenic features within the identified theme of the Study Area. The Study Area in Houston, Texas, involves residents, businesses, nonprofits, and governments with a financial plan and management entity for a national heritage area. The conceptual boundary map is supported by the public. The Study Area in Houston, Texas includes Shepherd Drive and the Turning Basin, known as the "Buffalo Bayou". The Secretary must submit a report on study results to the House Committee on Resources and the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources within 3 years of funds being available for this section. The curr_chunk can be summarized as: "Speaker of the House of Representatives and Vice President of the United States."
